result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner
Initial Appearance set for April 4, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 2
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

1:22 PM Defendant Jeffrey L McIntee appeared by video, in custody.  Atty Anne Renc appeared on behalf of the Defendant.  Petitioner State of WI, ADA Kelly Cassidy, appeared in person.

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Methamphetamine, Possession of THC and Possession of Paraphernalia.
Atty Renc does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $2,000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Renc does not have any objections as to bond.  
Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
